column4: hey, quick question - I have an amplified microphone plugged into line-in on the back of the PC - how do I get ekiga to use it? - It seems to only want to use microphones plugged into mic-in
i don't have Ekiga, but isn't it just a matter of enabling line-in recording in the GNOME mixer?
I see a mic selection - I can choose mic1 or mic2, that's it :( - I can change the volume but that's output volume, not input volume
is that in the mixer, or in Ekiga?
mixer- there's nothing in ekiga
it just allows me to pick my soundcard
i'm on KDE so can't really relate to the GNOME mixer, but i think there have to be recording selections. can you pastebin the output of « amixer » ?
I tried various mixers :)
not amixer though - what can I do with amixer?
the same things you can do with any other mixer. but aside from KMix, it's the only one i can give you instructions about (and the only one giving complete output to pastebin)
hmm, wait mixer says capture: off -- how do I turn it on, lo
amixer*
can you please just pastebin the entire output first?
I'm using a 10" touchscreen with no right click, lol - but it says for linein that capture: off
let me see if I can do anything with the help of the man page, one sec
oh beautiful! - I had to press space in alsamixer - itworks now!
thanks!
wonder how the echo cancellaton is on line-in -- got a terrible echo in the test, lets make a call :)
uhm, i don't think echo cancellation is a soundcard thing, but rather a software thing done within Ekiga
of course you should have playback for line-in *disabled* in the mixer
thanks
